availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William J. Salyer (Magoffin County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Magoffin County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Luanna A. Salyer. Father of Henderson Salyer, John W. Salyer, Fielding Salyer, Breckenridge Salyer, Josephine Salyer, M.J. Salyer, and Mary Salyer. Resident of Floyd County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Magoffin County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Floyd County, p. 449A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Magoffin County, p. 430.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Country, p. 282B.
"William J. 'Butler' Salyer (1826-1902)," Find A Grave, Memorial 27696104, accessed November 6, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/27696104.
